title: Camaraderie 2013 Crawford Vineyard Tempranillo (Yakima Valley)
description: Wood spice, vanilla and dark-fruit aromas are followed by tart game and red-fruit flavors. The wood seems very primary.

title: Cass 2015 Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated orange blossom, bubblegum and a touch of minerality show on the nose of this bottling, suggesting sweetness. The palate is dry, if a tad syrupy, revealing warm climate flavors like poached apple, pear and lemon curd, tasting a bit like cough syrup.

title: Lawer 2015 Cannon Block Chardonnay (Knights Valley)
description: From an estate vineyard, this wine is robust, full-bodied and viscous, with an underlying hint of petrol and plenty of oak. There's a tartness behind its flavors that gives it a lift as it finds its way to the finish.

title: Leaping Horse 2015 Chardonnay (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has more earthy and floral flavors than straightforward fruit, so it's something a bit different. Well-priced and easy to drink, it can please a crowd.

title: Global Wines 2013 Cabriz Touriga Nacional (Dão)
description: Tasting strongly of spicy wood, this wine is firm, with a tight, granitic texture. Tannins and acidity anchor its blackberry fruit, yielding a structured wine that is ready to drink.

title: Domaine du Touch 2015 White (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Produced in the region that also produces wine for Armagnac distillation, the wine is soft and light. It has a tangy edge along with white and citrus fruit. The mineral, zesty texture will allow the wine to age for a few more months. Drink from mid-2017.

title: Greenwood Ridge 2013 Hundred Point Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino Ridge)
description: Contrary to its name, this isn't exactly a 100-point wine, but it is ripe and full-flavored. Smooth on the palate and almost soft in texture, it's medium-bodied and very drinkable.

title: Ehret 2010 Bella's Blend Cabernet Sauvignon-Cabernet Franc (Knights Valley)
description: This Cabernet Sauvignon-dominant blend boasts leather, tobacco leaf and black pepper flavors, giving it muscle and a rustic edge, the tannins and fruit mellowed with age.

title: Indaba 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)
description: This easy-to-like wine is loaded with forward citrus tones alongside additional scents of gooseberry and fresh grass. The lightweight mouthfeel gets a little lazy on the midpalate, but bright citrus flavors and ample acidity help to keep the finish fresh and lively. Drink now.

title: Heron Hill 2015 Unaoked Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Fresh lemon and red-apple flavors are bright and clean in this medium-bodied dry white. While brisk in texture and approachably fresh, the finish is marked by a bite of astringency.

title: Robertson Winery 2015 Chenin Blanc (Robertson)
description: A pleasant herbal character dominates the nose of this wine, expressed in waves of lemongrass, verbena and fynbos. Additional notes of firm pear, green melon and lemon provide a solid backbone. It's lightweight and clean, finishing fresh and easy. Drink now.

title: Falua 2015 Tagus Creek Shiraz-Trincadeira Red (Alentejano)
description: An open, ripe and fruity wine made to be drunk young, this has black currant and spice flavors, plenty of acidity to keep it crisp and balanced tannins. The aftertaste is bright and lively.

title: Famiglia Cielo NV  Prosecco
description: This fun sparkler opens with aromas of spring flower and white stone fruit. The frothy palate delivers Granny Smith apple and white peach alongside refreshing acidity.

title: Fat Barrel 2015 Barrelman's Select Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)
description: This opens with scents of green melon rind, strawberry hull and lime that carry through to the palate alongside an additional note of peach. A pleasant grassy tone gives interest to the finish, while ample acidity keeps the palate fresh and clean. Drink now.

title: Peter Mertes 2015 Platinum Sweet Red Dornfelder (Rheinhessen)
description: Vanilla and spice aromas lend confectionery notes to this soft, slightly syrupy red wine. Sweet and fleshy on the palate, it's light in alcohol and acidity. The finish is marked by fine but rigid tannins.

title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2015 Rosé (Douro)
description: This is a fashionably pale rosé, as light and bright in color as it is on the palate. Fruity, attractive and ready to drink, it has zesty orange peel and crisp wild strawberry flavors.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

title: Rigal 2012 Château Beauvillain-Monpezat Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)
description: This is a smooth, soft wine that is full of black fruits and ripe tannins. The Merlot rounds out the rougher edges of the Malbec to give a rich juicy wine that will develop quickly. It is all fruit, generous and ready to drink from 2017.

title: Martinez & Martinez 2015 Tudor Hills Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley)
description: Aromas of ripe (leaning almost overripe) apple, melon and orange peel are followed by medium-sweet fruit flavors. It needs more acid to stand it up.

title: Obelisco Estate 2015 Estate Grown Cabernet Rosé (Red Mountain)
description: This wine is a pale cherry-red in color, showing some bricking. It brings off-dry elegantly styled cherry flavors that winnow toward the finish.

title: Robert Hall 2015 Rose de Robles Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: Deep pink in color, this blend of 42% Syrah, 30% Grenache, 11% Cinsaut, 11% Mourvèdre and 6% Counoise offers light strawberry and pomegranate aromas on the tightly wound nose. Bountiful, refreshing acidity powers the palate, but the flavors are sparse, just hinting at sour raspberry and pomegranate.

title: Orsi Family Vineyards 2013 Aglianico (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Dried cranberry and currant flavors with raisin-plum cake undertones define this light-bodied wine that's mildly tannic, tart, simple and easy to like.

title: Parducci 2015 Small Lot Blend Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: A smoky scent and earthy, crisp-apple flavors make this medium-bodied wine a change of pace from the average butterball Chardonnay. It has welcome acidity and a nicely smooth texture.

title: Swedish Hill 2015 Humphreys Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Dusty minerals and smoked nuts permeate through savory tones of apple and pear in this off-dry Riesling. It's a light-footed wine with soft yielding acidity.

title: South Coast 2016 Dry Gewurztraminer (Temecula Valley)
description: Round peach, ripe nectarine, melon and Anjou pear aromas shows on the nose of this bottling, tempered by a grassy and wet steel character. The palate shows poached apple and pear flavors, accented with lime.

title: Ideology 2014 Blondie Gone Wild Red Hen Vineyard Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)
description: Dark gold in color, this wine is marked by floral jasmine aromas before toasty oak and weightiness take over on the palate. Green apple and tropical flourishes provide additional richness.
designation: Blondie Gone Wild Red Hen Vineyard

title: Vergelegen 2015 Schaapenberg Vineyard Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)
description: This wine opens softly, with faint aromas of lemon-lime citrus and lean green fruit. The medium-weight palate offers a bit more concentration in green plum and lime tones, finishing pithy and somewhat bitter.

title: The Naked Grape NV Chardonnay (California)
description: This is an easygoing wine that's neither too oaky nor too crisp, with a decent blend of ripe pear and baking spice flavors paired with soft, smooth texture.

title: The Naked Grape NV Harvest Red (California)
description: This red blend is nicely dry, with abundant of dark plum and pomegranate flavors and a full-bodied, moderately tannic mouthfeel. It's easy to drink but bold enough to pair with hearty proteins.

title: Three Brothers 2015 3 Degrees of Riesling Sweet Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Earthier and dustier than the drier versions of Riesling in this series, this sweet-style wine permeates with notes of crushed rocks and bramble. Soft yielding acidity and slightly sugary sweetness linger on the finish.

title: Tin Barn 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Blended with small amounts of Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Malbec, this is an austere, unfussy red made in modest quantities that has crisp red currant and cranberry flavors interwoven with cedar and dried herb.
